message.raw:
Some RFBlaster related changes.

Labscript pseudoclocks now store all timespoints at 64 bit floats. This helps the RFblaster's preprocessor wrap repetitive timesteps into loops better. The rounding error in 32 bit floats was growing larger than the RFblaster's quantisation.

Also, labscript now uses RFJuice's Cython compiler. It is much faster. To get it, pull + update your mercurual working copy of rfjuice, go into the cython folder, and compile the extension by running:

python setup.py build_ext --inplace
